s.text: President Clinton halted a strike by American Airlines pilots . Using the rarely invoked Railway Labor Act of 1926, he forced the pilots to postpone the strike for two months while federal mediators try to resolve the dispute.

President Clinton halted a strike by American Airlines pilots . Using the rarely invoked Railway Labor Act of 1926, he forced the pilots to postpone the strike for two months while federal mediators try to resolve the dispute.

Pundits agree that the benefits of intervention (pleasing passengers and saving jobs in politically important states) and the low political cost (angering 9,000 pilots who are mostly Republican and are isolated from the rest of organized labor) made this a no-brainer for Clinton.
